results.title: Metformin induced autophagy in diabetes mellitus - Tuberculosis co-infection patients: A case study.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ induced autophagy in @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetes mellitus@@@ - @<m>DISEASE_Coinfection</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D060085 @@@Tuberculosis co-infection@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@: A case study.

citations.NLM: Novita BD, Ali M, Pranoto A, Soediono EI, Mertaniasih NM. Metformin induced autophagy in diabetes mellitus - Tuberculosis co-infection patients: A case study. Indian J Tuberc. 2019 Jan;66(1):64-69. PMID: 30797286

results.title: Impact of concurrent macrovascular co-morbidities on healthcare utilization in patients with type 2 diabetes in Europe: a matched study.
results.text_hl: Included @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ were aged > or =30 years at time of diagnosis of @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@T2DM@@@ who added a @CHEMICAL_Sulfonylurea_Compounds @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013453 @@@sulfonylurea@@@ or a PPARgamma agonist to failing @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ monotherapy (index date) and had concurrent @<m>DISEASE_Coinfection</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D060085 @@@MVC@@@ (cases).

citations.NLM: Fu AZ, Qiu Y, Radican L, Yin DD, Mavros P. Impact of concurrent macrovascular co-morbidities on healthcare utilization in patients with type 2 diabetes in Europe: a matched study. Diabetes Obes Metab. 2010 Jul;12(7):631-7. PMID: 20590738
citations.BibTeX: @article{20590738, title={Impact of concurrent macrovascular co-morbidities on healthcare utilization in patients with type 2 diabetes in Europe: a matched study.}, author={Fu AZ and Qiu Y and Radican L and Yin DD and Mavros P}, journal={Diabetes Obes Metab}, volume={12}, number={7}, pages={631-7}}

results.title: Metformin associated inflammation levels regulation in type 2 diabetes mellitus-tuberculosis coinfection patients - A case report.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@MET@@@ was used at least 2 months, accompanying with @GENE_INS @GENE_3630 @@@insulin@@@ and; anti-TB and as comparison to non @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@MET@@@ group.

citations.NLM: Novita BD, Soediono EI, Nugraha J. Metformin associated inflammation levels regulation in type 2 diabetes mellitus-tuberculosis coinfection patients - A case report. Indian J Tuberc. 2018 Oct;65(4):345-349. PMID: 30522623
